condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Population affected by emergencies have access to water, improved sanitation facilities and appropriate hygiene practices (hand washing with soap and household water treatment).

description.narrative: In 2019, more than 128,000 people in humanitarian situations were provided with sufficient quantity of water and personal hygiene through UNICEF-supported programmes out of the 105,000 targeted in the revised 2019 HAC. UNICEF signed standby PCAs with 5 NGOs that will provide emergency responses in regions prone to cyclones, drought and disease outbreaks. In addition, UNICEF contributed to the prepositioning of WASH stocks in 16 regions. UNICEF as cluster lead agency for WASH with the Government, led the emergency preparedness and response to the 2019 emergencies for Idai and Belna cyclones, as well as the drought in the South. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
